entry.title: Re: Clarification of basic RAP pattern
entry.content: not sure what you are trying to achieve. your current top entity is not part of the BO(I_BILLINGDOCUMENTREQUESTTP), so it is not relevant for mapped. for 6, you just create an association, any difficulty?

entry.title: Re: delete a user in sap lms
entry.content: @user116, it's possible that this user isn't a Learning only user anymore. In the Learning Administration area > In the user record > "User Details" tab > A note should be displayed stating something like "Certain fields on the page are read-only because they contain HR data and should be maintained in your core HR system of record". This means this user exists in BizX as well. The deletion of users under this scenario needs to take place in BizX, via DRTM (KBA 2615360). For Learning only users (not existing in BizX), you may advance with the "Native User Deletion" automatic process (KBA 2515540).

entry.title: Re: Employee using QR code to self register to course and...
entry.content: @Kelly_Sherwood, as it stands, this option isn't currently available. There are some enhancement request related to this topic (link1, link2, link3). If none of them fulfill your business requirement, you could create a new one (KBA 2090228), so it's reviewed by the Learning Product Management team.

entry.title: Re: Can we add extra materials in "Additional Item tab" during BDR creation
entry.content:
Hello Feras,

Quick question... how are we supposed to invoice equipment used during service?

Let's say that on my T&M work package, I plan my resources as Team and equipment as Additional Resources. How I'm supposed to show to the customer on the invoice items, the equipment used to  provide the service if I can't post my Additional Items usage nor input new materials on Additional Items on the BDR? The users need to input all of that into Additional Items using those 2 materials?

Thanks.

entry.title: Como criar blogs incríveis a partir das palestras dos eventos SAP?
entry.content:
@moshenaveh compartilhou uma metodologia prática para transformar apresentações de eventos em blogs rápidos e envolventes. Eis os passos-chave:

1️⃣Use o tutorial do SAP Community para habilitar o blogging.
2️⃣Crie um template dedicado ao evento (pré e pós-evento).
3️⃣Transforme sua apresentação em texto com apoio de IA.
4️⃣Revise gramática/estilo com ferramentas de IA.
5️⃣Enriqueça com imagens, slides e mídia.
6️⃣Seja transparente → use a tag GenAIAssistedContent.
7️⃣Publique na seção correta da comunidade.
8️⃣Promova nas redes sociais e interaja nos comentários.

Essa abordagem reduz o tempo de criação de horas para minutos, motiva mais palestrantes a compartilhar conhecimento  e amplia o impacto das sessões.

Que tal aplicar essas dicas no próximo evento que você participar?

Vejam este blog como exemplo criado a partir de palestras realizadas

entry.title: Transport of analytical query variants
entry.content:
Hello,

Is it possible to transport analytical query variant created with queries from the Query Browser app (F1068)? I cannot find any documentation on this subject. Look forward to your response. 

 

Kind regards,

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Transport of analytical query variants
entry.content:
Hello customer,

Indeed, the recommendations to transport analytical queries bookmarks/variants is outlined in the KBA 0003361686: Bookmarks transportation guidance.

Transporting bookmarks is not possible in releases lower than SAP_BW 757. This new functionality is available only from SAP_BW 757 release.

Only public bookmarks can be transported. Transport of BW Bookmarks is possible via two ABAP reports:

  • FPM_BICS_TRANSPORT_BOOKMARKS: Collect the desired Bookmarks in a customizing request in the source system. The customizing request can be then released via transaction SE09.
  • FPM_BICS_IMPORT_BOOKMARKS: Import the transported Bookmarks into the BICS environment of the target system.

Refer to SAP Note 3336542 - BICS Data Grid: Transport of Bookmarks.

Best Regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: crossboarding- legal entity transfer
entry.content: Hi - question in follow up to this. What if there is a gap between the existing employment and the future employment? If the start date is not term date + 1 day - how could the transfering employee access ONB to complete necessary steps when they become inactive in their existing role and a true "external" again?

entry.title: How to charge equipment on Professional Services
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I'm having the following situation:

We are implementing professional services for a customer that needs to charge T&M and equipment on the invoice from the project. I'm not finding the ideal place to input the equipment and send it all the way into the invoice. I've tried using additional resources from the work package, but those will not transfer into the Project Billing Request (when it's T&M). I've been able to do it through the additional items from the Project Billing Requests, but they are hard coded materials (B001 and B002). Also, when we check the additional items on the invoice, it shows as the actual product name eventough the description has been changed manually (which is confusing to the user).

I'd like to know if there's any other recommended method.

Thanks.

entry.title: creating workflow CR to block/unblock employee in SAP MDG
entry.content:
Hi 

need help in creating workflow CR. i never worked on such requirement before and don't know either how to do and you such help in youtube and google for this requirement.
please guide me step by step what i have to do.


add the ability to block / unblock employee vendors through workflow. This needs to happen at general and company code level.

 

Create a new Workflow CR to Block/Unblock the Employee record.

Vendor type: Employee

Auth group: EMPL

 

Security: Security authorization to restrict based on the Geo’s.

 

Below mentioned are the fields that should be allowed to be modified:

No.

SAP Field

Description

1

BUT000- XDELE

Archiving Flag

2

BUT000- XBLCK

Central Block

3

LFA1- LOEVM

Deletion Flag

4

LFA1- SPERR

Posting Block

5

LFA1- SPERM

Purch. block

6

LFB1- SPERR

Co.code post.block

7

LFB1- LOEVM

Co.Cde Deletion Flag

8

LFB1- ZAHLS

Payment Block

Can an S-User ID be initiated and assigned to these users, or must they register with a .com e-mail account?

entry.title: Re: Target hours not appearing in Manage My Timesheet
entry.content:
Hello @SAPSupport 

Could you please load target hours by firstly ensuring daily availability is in place and then confirming the employee has the correct Data Entry Profile? Check availability using CDS I_TimeOverviewByWrkAgrmtAndDte;

if you are not using SuccessFactors EC, create or replicate availability via API_MANAGE_WF_AVAILABILITY. Next, verify Maintain Data Entry Profiles (Time Recording) so the timesheet displays recorded and target hours. If it still doesn’t appear, please review KBA 3391722 for common causes (work schedule validity, holiday calendar, employment dates).

SAP Help Portal-Time Overview of a Work Agreement (From Manage Workforce Availability API)

entry.title: SAP Customer Conversations: Executive Strategy with Delta Airlines
entry.content:
Join us in the upcoming SAP Customer Conversations LIVE Event hosted by Delta Air Lines. 

Hear Tim Gregory, Managing Director - HR Innovation and Workforce Technology @ Delta Air Lines, share his executive overview on Delta's Talent Transformation, as well as long-term goals and expected outcome investment.

Register now

About:

Delta Air Lines, Inc. is a major airline in the United States and ranks first in revenue & brand value among the world's largest airlines, and second by number of passengers carried, passenger miles flown, & fleet size. As a purpose-driven brand, Delta strives to connect its over 100,000 employees to opportunities both in the air and on the ground. By moving to a skills-based talent strategy, Delta is improving the lives of its people and realizing its vision for a virtuous circle of satisfied employees, customers, and shareholders.

Event Agenda:

  • Introductions
  • Executive level overview
  • Long term goals
  • Expected outcome of investment
  • Interactive Q&A session

Challenges and Highlights:
For years, Delta had been relying on learning and performance solutions from SAP to equip employees for success. However, the airline knew it had many employees with hidden skills, talents, and career aspirations that had yet to be discovered. To realize their goal, Delta wanted to create a digital virtuous circle by using technology to better align customer expectations with employee skills.
By moving to a skills-based talent strategy, Delta has surpassed its goal of filling 25% of
its managerial roles with internal hires from customer-facing positions—reaching nearly 50%. By unlocking employee potential and enhancing skills, Delta is creating a cycle of engaged employees, satisfied customers, and long-term shareholder investment.

SAP Solutions: (Reference Customer SAP solutions landscape) 

Delta is using SAP SuccessFactors Opportunity Marketplace to enhance workforce agility by connecting employees with career pathways and relevant recommendations for growth. Talent Intelligence Hub is used to refine career development and internal mobility using data-driven insights from a vast job attributes library. In addition, Delta is utilizing SuccessFactors Compensation, Learning, and SAP Build Work Zone to support its broader skills evolution journey, reinforcing its commitment to internal mobility, learning, and employee experience.

entry.title: Re: Display List report as Result From RAP Application Af...
entry.content:
@Abhishek4795 

The easiest way is to return "$self" from the action as shown in the example below:

action some_action result [1] $self;

In the behavior implementation, update the entity and get the updated entity, then return the result.

    "read changed data for action result
    READ ENTITIES OF zi_person_m IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY person
        ALL FIELDS WITH
        CORRESPONDING #( keys )
        RESULT DATA(persons).

    result = VALUE #( FOR person IN persons ( %tky = person-%tky
                                              %param = person ) ).

entry.title: [In-person] SAP ALM Deep Dive Workshop - Melbourne Edition
entry.content:
Hello All,

We’re excited to invite you to our in-person SAP Cloud ALM Deep Dive Workshops, taking place across SAP offices in Australia and New Zealand this October and November.

This full-day event is crafted to provide you with valuable insights and hands-on experience in managing operations and implementations with SAP Cloud ALM, helping you drive business transformation efficiency and innovation.

Why attend?

Explore the latest advancements and innovations in SAP Cloud ALM for implementation and operation through firsthand experience. You can also earn the Solution Transformation Consultant Badge by completing the assessment and take advantage of the opportunity to network with experts and peers exchanging insights, best practices and learnings.

Event Highlights:

  • Explore the importance of a robust ALM strategy for driving business growth and agility.
  • Gain in-depth knowledge about SAP Cloud ALM and its pivotal role in managing intelligent cloud and hybrid business landscapes.
  • Explore new topics including AI use cases, integration into the tool chain, and support for RISE with SAP & Clean Core.
  • Participate in a hands-on session to learn how the integrated toolchain of SAP Cloud ALM, SAP Signavio, and SAP LeanIX helps customers smoothly transition to an intelligent enterprise.
  • Understand the transition path from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM.
  • Enhance your expertise by taking the Solution Transformation Consultant Badge test, which will demonstrate your ability to effectively manage the design to deploy phase of business transformations using an integrated approach with an end-to-end tool chain.

Please note: We encourage you to bring your own laptop for the workshop. A dedicated network will be provided during the hands-on sessions and the Solution Transformation Consultant Badge test.

Visit our website for detailed information on the agenda, timings, and location. 

Registration is free, but subject to approval!

Register Now

entry.title: Re: To start GRDC package from the "Closing balance value"
entry.content:
Thank you for your great advice!

I have confirmed the functionality.
I was aware of the new feature in 2508, and thought that it would be possible to enter total amounts in columns with transaction type = blank, but since the feature "treats data with missing dimensions as total amount entry," I was able to achieve this by completely removing sub-items from the package form.

However, due to the specifications described above, it is not possible to display opening balance values ​​in input forms that require total amount entry.
I look forward to future updates to address this functional limitation.

entry.title: Re: Lot sizing procedure "EX" reaction with sales order i...
entry.content: Hi @nicolasduches This is the standard behavior for EX as MRP groups all requirements that fall on the same date into a single planned order. For your requirement, you may consider using Fixed Lot Size or MTO scenario. Best regards, Corey

entry.title: Re: Transfer Direct Reports upon Termination
entry.content:
Hi @waitzechin15,

As far as I have understood your question, you want the assignment of the direct reports to the next available position in the position hierarchy, and you don't want to give any other option to the user. You can do so by putting (Position Management Settings -->)  Reassign Direct Reports According to Position Hierarchy on Termination Screen and Internal Hire Screen to "Yes-Always" as shown below.

Hope this helps!

Jayendra

entry.title: Re: CRforVS stuck forever on 13.0.26? (type initializer f...
entry.content: Hi André, did you check the app.config? In my blog you'll notice they changed the location of the assemblies and now no more references to the CR assemblies in the coinfig file. Error suggests it's trying to load old assemblies.

entry.title: Finance Part2 & Reporting - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Live Customers
entry.content:
This is only relevant for Partners and Live Customers who are required to transit Production system data with EUR adoption in Bulgaria. How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers

In the 6th session offered by ASC Cloud ERP Expertise Services, the main topic covered is around Finance (part 2) and Reporting

  • Recording
  • Presentatio
  • Accelerator Guide
    • Fix Asset Implementation Accelerator - Data Extraction via Customer Data Return App
    • Preparing Embedded Analytics

Key Discussion Points‌

‌1. Finance Part 2 - Fixed Asset Migration‌

  • ‌Company Code Synchronization:‌ Ensure newly created company codes are synchronized for asset accounting via the "Make Company Code Settings Asset-Specific" app.
  • ‌Low Value Asset Threshold:‌ Customizing for low-value assets currently cannot be modified; updates will be rolled out in the 2508.3 release by November.
  • ‌Legacy Data Transfer Settings:‌ Define migration key dates (e.g., December 31, 2025) and set data transfer status to "Ongoing" for transactional postings.
  • ‌Master Data Migration:‌ Use the "Customer Data Return - Extraction" app (F5233) and the “Customer Data Return – Provisioning" app (F5234) to extract fixed asset data (XML/CSV format) for template uploads. Key recommendations:
    • Migrate main and sub-asset numbers in the same project.
    • Manually transfer assets under construction and link them post-migration.
    • Deactivated assets must be migrated as active and deactivated later.
  • ‌Posting Migration:‌ Extract accumulated APC/depreciation values via the "Depreciation List" app (F1616) in both cases, fiscal year equals calendar year (year-end-migration) and fiscal year differs from calendar year (during-the-year-migration). "Asset Transactions" app (F1614) can be used to extract posted data until your migration date (for during-the-year-migration).

‌2. Analytics & Reporting Transition:‌

  • ‌Custom CDS Views:‌ Check join conditions, calculations (e.g., hardcoded company codes), and currency field properties. Use parameters for dynamic filtering.
  • ‌Custom Analytical Queries:‌ Implement restricted measures (e.g., "Amount Before Migration") to separate pre/post-transition data. Add currency conversion measures for EUR transitions.
  • ‌Testing & Validation:‌ Prioritize external reporting, validate with business users, and update bookmarks/filters (e.g., company code, plant).

Live Questions & Answers

Topic Area‌

‌Question‌

‌Answer

Low Value Asset Testing

Can we test low-value asset processes before the November hotfix?

No, EUR related low-value assets tests can be performed once release 2508.3 is rolled out in November 2025.

Fixed Asset Data Extraction

How is the extracted XML used for migration?

The XML consolidates asset data (e.g., master data, ledgers) for easier template population. Data must be manually copied into migration cockpit templates.

Analytics Filtering

How to handle legacy vs. migrated data in reports?

Avoid global filters; use restricted measures (e.g., "Amount Before Migration") and mandatory parameters (e.g., company code) for accurate comparisons.

 

Call-to-Action

Register and Attend Upcoming Webinar presented by SAP Service experts with practical suggestions

  • Register Now [Sept 24th] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Sales, Q&A for all area)
  • please kindly bookmark this blog - How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers (with all accelerators, replay, upcoming session)

entry.title: 【Joule Studio】Associationが張られたODataを展開してリスト表示するJoule Skillの実装
entry.content:
Joule Studio でカスタムスキルを開発する際に、Associationが張られたODataを取得し、展開してリスト表示したいという場合があります。今回は以下の２つのシナリオにおいて、Joule Skill を開発する手順をご紹介します。

1対NのAssociation：著者の名前をクリックすると著書（複数）が確認できる

1対1のAssociation：本のタイトルをクリックすると詳細を確認できる

※基本的にそれぞれ同様の手順で実装できるため、ここからは1対Nの場合についてご紹介しています。

また、Associationとはエンティティを同士の関係性を表すもので、以下のようにデータ同士を紐付けて表現するためのものです。

 

【前準備】Actionにexpandのクエリを追加

Associationが張られたODataを取得するために、入力パラメータの欄にexpandを追加します。そして、展開したいプロパティを固定値として設定することで、該当するActionが呼び出されるたびに、ODataを展開して取得できるようになります。

 

【Joule Skill の作成】

Joule Skillの出力パラメータにおいて、出力形式を以下のように設定します。ここでリストを選択することで、次に設定する出力項目において、リスト形式のプロパティを選択できるようになります。

そして、スキルの出力項目として表示したいリスト（展開する前のプロパティ）を選択します。 

Associationが張られたODataを展開して表示させるために追加で必要な設定は以上です。

基本的なODataを表示させるJoule Skillの開発手順としては、以下のブログが分かりやすいのでご参照ください。
Joule Studioがリリースされたので早速CAPアプリを自然言語で操作するカスタムスキルを構築してみた

 

【出力例】

1対NのAssociation：著者の名前（左）／選択した著者による複数の著書（右）

1対1のAssociation：本のタイトル（左）／選択した本の詳細（右）

 

【補足】

1対1の場合は Send Messageを追加して表示する項目を細かく指定することも可能です。

また、1対Nの場合には一覧表示するためのカードの右側（詳細ビュー）が、現時点ではリスト表示に対応していないため、今回のような表示形式になっています。

entry.title: SAP for Me バックアップエラーに関するCaseの通知について
entry.content:
ご担当者様

お世話になっております。
バックアップエラーが発生した場合に、メールなどで検知したいと考えております。
現状は、不定的にバックアップエラーが発生した場合、都度SAP社に下記のようなCaseを起票いただいているかと思います。
Caseが起票された際、CaseのContactsタブに担当者のメールアドレスを追加されていないため、
メールが届かず、バックアップエラーが発生したかどうか、検知が難しい状態となっております。
なおMy setting＞Support-Related Notifications>Cases ・Very High CasesのE-Mail スイッチはONになっております。

バックアップエラーが発生した際に、メールで検知する方法について、ご教授いただきたいと思います。


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SAP Personas table /PERSONAS/FLVCCH accesing perforan...
entry.content:
What S/4HANA release is your system on? S/4HANA 2023 and SP18 in combination had significant effort to improve performance with RFUI flavors. On lower releases, performance is not as optimized.

Also, as a usual recommendation: Try deleting all flavor versions older than the most recent one permanently (not just mark as deleted) and compress the undo history / changes for the latest flavor version. You can do these in the Admin application.

As per requirement from business .PAYMENT TERM (Z888)need to be blocked.

But condition is that, it should not impact invoices for which payments are due. Means it should be done for future  payments not for one for which invoice already done with mentioned payment term(Z888)

Reply awaited

Aman Jain

FIN (Finance) MM Invoice Verification FIN Accounts Receivable and Payable

entry.title: Re: Will people still able to access my iflow even after...
entry.content: Yes, they could technically access the iFlow directly if they know the endpoint URL. However, access to the CPI endpoint is still secured—you’d need proper authorization, such as a service key or OAuth credentials, depending on how you’ve configured authentication for that iFlow. Without valid credentials, they won’t be able to send or process any requests.

entry.title: Missing SR INTERNAL LB
entry.content:
From the My Service request console I'm missing the entry "Create Hyperscaler LB for INBOUND traffic from an INTERNAL source (Azure/AWS/GCP)". I only see the entry for EXTERNAL LB. Can you please provide 


--- Support Assistant ---
Private Cloud Service Request


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Missing SR INTERNAL LB
entry.content:
Hi Jan,

The reason why you are unable to raise request "Create Hyperscaler LB for INBOUND traffic from an INTERNAL source (Azure/AWS/GCP) " is because you don't have the necessary authorization to do so.

In order to submit a service request for the 'Create Hyperscaler LB template for INBOUND traffic from an EXTERNAL source (Azure/AWS/GCP)' template, an S-user must have the authorization 'Create Billable Service Requests' at the customer number level.

Upon reviewing your S-user ID, I found that the required authorization was only assigned at the installation level. Usually, you will need to contact your administrator listed in Users & Contacts - SAP for Me to have the authorization assigned. For more detailed information on S-user authorizations required the Private Cloud Service Request application, please refer to KBA 2669783 - S-user authorizations required for the Private Cloud Service Request application - SAP for... 

If you have any questions or require additional assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Have a nice day!

Best regards,
SAP Support

We will list examples of what we wish to achieve.
If any information is missing, please let us know.

We have a requirement to display the fiscal year in the chart title.
For the fiscal year, we want to use whichever is newer: the fiscal year calculated from the system date or the fiscal year calculated from the date in the dimension item.
To achieve this, we believe we first need to understand how to calculate the fiscal year from the system date.

For example, if today's date (2025/9/12) corresponds to fiscal year 2025,

we want the chart title to display “Fiscal Year 2025”.

entry.title: Re: Lot sizing procedure in APP Monitor Material Coverage...
entry.content:
Hello @nicolasduches 

Thank you for your question to the community.

You are right those functionalities are not available in the public cloud because the app has a predefined set of filters and display columns delivered by SAP.

Here are some available options to add it.

  • You can use Custom CDS Views app to extend the underlying data model for material coverage with the field Lot Sizing Procedure. Then Create a Custom Analytical Query and publish it as a Fiori app. This enables you to replicate the material coverage functionality and include the additional fields like Lot Sizing.
  • Secondly, you can use the custom field logic. If the lot sizing field is not exposed in your relevant business context, you cannot add it directly. In that case, you can use CFL to expose it if that business context is provided by SAP.
  • Finally, if your purpose is analysis rather than operational rescheduling, use apps like monitor Material Coverage or Manage Material Shortages and complement them with a custom analytical report ensuring you include Lot Size.

Consider submitting a request via the SAP Customer Influence Portal to have Lot Sizing procedure included as a standard field in the app.

App Extensibility: Manage Material Coverage (F0251A)

Lot-Sizing Procedures

I hope this provides the desired insight. Do not hesistate if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to prevent creating planned order when MRP run wi...
entry.content:
Hi @nicolasduches 

Thank you for your question.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, when an item's BOM is inactive, MRP may still create a planned order with empty components, since the system cannot find a BOM to explode. However, when converting to a production order, the system does block the creation due to missing components. There is currently no delivered configuration to make MRP block planned order creation for materials with inactive BOMs. Planned orders are created based on requirements, not BOM status.

Below are some workaround recommendations

  • Ensure that inactive BOMs are not just flagged inactive but they also should not have a validity date range. If the BOM is outside its validity period, MRP will not consider it and the requirement should trigger exception.
  • Consider using MRP 4 view as the selection method. If this is set to 2 which is the production version, then MRP requires a valid and released production version. If no valid production version exists, MRP will not create a planned order and will raise an excelption message.
  • The recommended SAP Best Practice is to use Production Versions as the default method for Bom or routing selection.
  • You can implement additional process controls, such as workflow notifications for materials with inactive BOMs, so planners can manually adjust requirements or BOM status before MRP run.

If this requirement is critical for your business process control, I suggest you consider raising a feature request on SAP’s Customer Influence Portal to provide an MRP enhancement for BOM activation status filtering.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP CAP project - database layer migration
entry.content:
Hi,

I have an existing SAP CAP project that contains a complete application structure including database models defined in schema.cds files. I want to refactor this monolithic structure by extracting and migrating the entire database layer (including all CDS data models, schema definitions, and database-related artifacts) into a completely separate, standalone CAP project. I will archive the existing project. 

The new database project should maintain the same namespace as the original project to ensure compatibility, and I need to establish proper dependencies and references so that my original project can continue to consume the database models from this new external database project.

How should I structure this migration, handle the cross-project dependencies, configure the build processes, manage deployment scenarios, and ensure that the new CAP project can work seamlessly while maintaining the existing namespace conventions and data model integrity?

Regards,

Minh

entry.title: Re: Reference Base Mapping in Top-Down Distribution in Un...
entry.content:
Hello @suyoung_choi3 

Thank you for your message to the community.

There is currently no standard option to upload mapping rules via Excel template in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, for Universal Allocation Top-Down Distribution.

The manage allocation and Define reference-based mapping apps as you have noticed only allow manual entry of single values, ranges or groups.

However, there are available options you can consider.

  • As of Release 2508, SAP has exposed APIs for allocation data objects. See SAP API Business Hub Universal Allocation APIs for more. There you can use APIs to mass-create mapping rules programmatically instead of using excel.
  • Centralized Maintenance can help you define groups in your reference data e.g., product groups and cost object groups and then you have the possibility to assign them instead of maintaining many single values.

Please note that SAP has identified this Excel upload feature as a gap. I recommend raising a request on the SAP influence portal.

Consult Universal Allocation   APIs on SAP Business Accelerator Hub for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Why Does BAPI_SALESORDER_CREATEFROMDAT2 Show Wrong Condition Values in VA02?
entry.content:
Recently, while working with BAPI_SALESORDER_CREATEFROMDAT2, I faced a strange issue.

 

I was trying to create a sales order with a custom condition type ZGTC.

Here’s what I did:

  • In the BAPI input, I passed KBETR = 94.0000000000.

  • During debugging, I could clearly see that the value was stored as 94.0000000000.

  • But after executing the BAPI and checking the order in VA02, the value appeared as 940.00!


    Why does the BAPI change my condition value from 94.00000000000 to 940.00?

entry.title: Re: How to charge equipment on Professional Services
entry.content:
Hello @zeck9762 

Please note that the recommended way to handle T&M billing of equipment is different from how you bill effort In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Professional Services.

It is important to note that the work package “additional resources” are not transferred into the Project Billing Request for T&M. They are mainly used for effort-relate roles.

The Additional Items option in Project Billing Request is intended only for one-time charges. Hence why you noticed that they are hard coded material and therefore not flexible for ongoing equipment billing. That also explains why you see one time credit item in your invoice. So, changing descriptions manually in the invoice does not solve the traceability issue you face and can be confusing for your end users.

The recommended approaches are:

  • User Material or Service Products in Sales integration. To achieve this, define equipment as a product master, then add it to the project billing profile so that it can flow into PBR as a billable item. By doing this, you ensure the equipment appears with its correct product ID and description on the invoice.
  • Next is to bill via Resource Related Billing. For your client’s equipment usage, you can configure it as a resource in your project planning but link it to a material or service product for billing purposes. Once you assign these to the right account and the correct project billing profile, these costs will flow into the PBR and then to the invoice.
  • Another one is to customize the Project Billing Profile. You have the possibility to extend the rules to include your client’s equipment usage posting as billable. Thereby, you can avoid relying on hardcoded one-time products.
  • Alternatively, if you only need occasional billing of equipment, make us of the Manage Manual Project Billing Items App to add the correct product instead of relying on B001/B002. This will give you more control than editing the invoice items directly.

Consult the following links for more details.

Manage Project Billing

Managing Billing for Services

Manage Project Billing Requests

https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-feature/cab0dc5c-6c85-4d8e-963a-cad7a64e012a/

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Approval Model Query Problem
entry.content:
Hi

I wonder about StickPrice I have not seen this Field before and it is not in my Database.

Have you checked which values come out when you try

SELECT
((T1."LineTotal" - (T1."Quantity" * T1."StickPrice"))   / NULLIF (T1."LineTotal", 0)) * 100 < 27 AS Test
FROM
QUT1 T1
WHERE
T1.DocEntry = XXXX

You don't need the OQUT Table

regards Lothar

entry.title: Re: SuccessFactors ONB Custom Task JSON Codat sample
entry.content:
Hi there,

In your Custom Task > Template Editor > Click on the 3 dots next to your 'Is Laptop and Charger Required' field and go to edit control > Under 'Data Reference', note down the value after #/properties/ > e.g. it will look like x-laptopRequired.

Then, follow this KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/3498129 and find the internal id of your drop-down value 'Yes'. It will look something like 57176705.

Then, click on the 3 dots on the field which you want to show based on the above field value, turn on rule and select SHOW and add the code in this format.

{
  "type": "LEAF",
  "scope": "#/properties/x-laptopRequired",
  "expectedValue": 57176705
}

Regards,

Divia

entry.title: Re: Unable to Create WT for Returns Delivery, item shows...
entry.content:
Hi @Lakshmi_Priya96 

Thank you for your question.

Based on your description, the issue is typically related to a mismatch in stock type assignment, stock lock status or availability group configuration for that particular item.

Check the following:

  • If the Item was assigned to a stock type or availability group in the delivery document that does not align with the actual quant status
  • Check the Warehouse Request or outbound delivery rules that might block picking or task creation.
  • Make sure there are no hidden reservation, open transfer or other system-imposed reasons that block the process for the item despite its availability.
  • Make sure there are no inconsistency in the stock synchronisation which may cause wrong stock pictures.

Recommendation

If all those are correctly done, try manually releasing or processing the Warehouse Request item using the EWM Monitor apps.

Consult the following links for more details.

Creating and Processing Outbound Deliveries

KBA 3459570 & KBA 3126573 

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: ONB2 - Custom Task JSON Rule for field visibility based on multiple values
entry.content:
Hi there,

Does anyone know the correct JSON format for ONB2 Custom Task to set field visibility based on multiple values (e.g., show a field if the value is Yes or Maybe)? I’ve tried several variations from the JSON Forms docs link in the implementation guide (https://jsonforms.io/docs/uischema/rules/) and generated JSON with ANYOF, but none are accepted in SuccessFactors custom task rules.

Where is this code going wrong, and does anyone know the correct format expected?

{
  "condition": {
    "type": "ANYOF",
    "conditions": [
      {
        "type": "LEAF",
        "scope": "#/properties/x-preventLeaving",
        "expectedValue": 57177256
      },
      {
        "type": "LEAF",
        "scope": "#/properties/x-preventLeaving",
        "expectedValue": 57177258
      }
    ]
  }
}

Thanks,

Divia

entry.title: Re: Lot sizing procedure "EX" reaction with sales order i...
entry.content: In your material master, set Individual/Collective requirements = 1 for the material. Verify minimum lot size, rounding value, and rounding profile don’t force merging. This change makes MRP create two planned orders when you have two same-day sales orders

entry.title: Re: Corrective Maintenance End To End Process with Material Management Integration
entry.content: Well explained!

entry.title: How to control PGI process between Sales and Supply Chain in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are working with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (web-based Fiori apps, though standard TCodes like MMBE are still available).

Here’s the scenario:

  1. Using MMBE, suppose we have 10,000 stock available.

  2. Multiple salesmen are creating sales orders, deliveries, posting PGI, and invoices.

  3. Sometimes, one user leaves the process incomplete (e.g., delivery created but invoice not done).

  4. After PGI, stock reduces in the system (e.g., from 10,000 → 5,000). However, when we check physical stock, it shows a mismatch (e.g., 6,000 physically available).

  5. This causes stock visibility and accountability issues for the supply chain team.

Requirement:
Instead of Sales doing PGI, we want to shift PGI responsibility to the Supply Chain team. This way, stock movement is fully controlled and monitored by them, avoiding mismatches and conflicts.

My question:

  • Is there a way in S/4HANA Public Cloud to restrict PGI so that only the Supply Chain team can execute it (not Sales)?

  • If yes, what’s the best practice or standard way to achieve this?

Thanks in advance for your guidance.

entry.title: Re: 🟡 Introducing the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt 🔨🪙 ... COMING SOON
entry.content: 🐈

entry.title: Re: Changing Pricing Type at time of billing based on mat...
entry.content:
I recommend to have "B" in your copy control as a default. Add a custom item‑level copying requirement or implement USEREXIT_PRICING_RULE to switch to G for the specific materials that must retain the sales order pricing.

Here, instead of hard-coding the logic, create a variable in TVARVC table say for example, the combination can be Sales Org / Sold-To / Plant / Material Group or Material. Why I suggested the plant is because, the same material can be extended to multiple plants and if your requirement is to differentiate between plants, then, this will help. So once you maintained the required combination, with the above exit, ask your ABAP team to add a logic in such a way to compare VBAK / VBAP with this variable table and populate the price accordingly. By not hard-coding, if the Business requirement changes at a later date, all you have to do is to update this TVARVC table and dependency of ABAP can be avoided.

entry.title: Notifications are not being sent on status changes triggered by the script.
entry.content: Notifications are not being sent on status changes triggered by the script. Is there any way to achieve this?

entry.title: Re: How to control PGI process between Sales and Supply C...
entry.content: Via an authorization profile, this can be achieved. The control points are Business roles and Business catalogs. So, first identify which Fiori apps and classic transactions a user can run. Then, filter what data a user can act on within an app which can be by shipping point, plant, delivery type. If Sales users don’t have the catalog that contains the PGI function, they simply can’t execute it, even if they can create deliveries.

you will have to prepare your own Notifications with condition 1 as true and include it in My quotes and Other Quotes in workflow.

entry.title: Vendor Invoice Posting
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

SAP FICO Scenario – Vendor Invoice Posting – FB60 / F-43

Path: Easy Access -> Accounting -> Financial Accounting->Accounts Payable->Document Entry-> FB60 – Invoice/ F-43 - Invoice - General


Scenario Question:
A vendor has supplied raw materials worth ₹1,00,000 plus 18% GST. You need to post this vendor invoice in SAP. How will you handle this transaction in SAP FICO?

Answer (Step-by-Step):
1. Transaction Code:
Use FB60 / F-43 (Vendor Invoice Posting).

2. Entry Details:

Vendor A/c (Credit) – ₹1,18,000 (₹1,00,000 + ₹18,000 GST)

Raw Material Expense/Inventory (Debit) – ₹1,00,000

Input GST A/c (Debit) – ₹18,000

3. Accounting Entry:

Dr Raw Material A/c ₹1,00,000
Dr Input CGST A/c ₹9,000
Dr Input SGST A/c ₹9,000

     Cr Vendor A/c ₹1,18,000

4. Explanation to Interviewer:

Vendor is credited since we owe him money.

Expense/Inventory is debited as we received goods.

GST is debited to claim input tax credit.

Pro Tip to Mention in Interview:
Always highlight how SAP automatically links this entry to the Reconciliation Account for vendors in G/L.

entry.title: Re: Extract G/L account line items via API with OAuth2.0...
entry.content:
Hello @andre_westra67 

Thank you for your question.

You have chosen the correct approach for G/L Account Line-Item extraction. However, OAuth 2.0 is not available and the option is greyed out as you observed. This is a designate design in the public cloud because not all APIs support OAuth 2.0 authentication yet.

The following options can be considered (recommendation)

  1. If you need direct extraction you must stick with the available SAP_COM_0303 certificate. For better security than basic user/password, client certificate-based authentication is recommended.
  2. Alternatively, you can consider using Custom CDS View and OData API. Here you can create a custom CDS View based on JournalEntryItemCube or related released views, then expose it as a custom communication. In this case, you can enable OAuth 2.0 authentication. This will give you the control access.
  3. You may also leverage the SAC live connection or Data Export API. This will require your dashboard to be centralised. Or leverage Data Export Services (SAP_COM_0536) which supports OAuth2.0 to extract finance data in your target system.

Consult the following links for more details.

G/L Account Line Items

Using SAP Analytics Cloud API Data Export Service from SAP S/4 HANA

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Group reporting: Unable to Consolidate correctly Equi...
entry.content:
Hello @TULLEYC 

I see what’s happening here. You have a two-tier indirect equity structure (J0184 → J0196 → J0197), but Group Reporting is removing the cost of investment in J0197 twice.

Document type 0Z (Prep Group Changes / PCC): removes the investment J0196 holds in J0197 (-8,000).

Document type 3A (Investment/Equity Elimination) removes the same cost again (-8,000).

FS item 172100 – Investments in Subs, JV and Associates, GV gets over-eliminated.

The reason why the error occurs is

In rules-based consolidation in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the system aims to reduce investment costs both:

At the direct parent/partner consolidation unit level (J0196 versus J0197), and at the ultimate parent consolidation group level (J0184 versus J0197, via equity method).

Because indirect shareholding is not automatically handled unless you adjust your consolidation methods / rules, both elimination steps fire.

How to fix/set up correctly

You need to manage where the elimination takes place.

Review the Consolidation Method assignment.

J0196 (equity method entity) → should use a method such as Equity Method (No Full Elimination).

J0197 should be linked only to J0196, not directly to J0184.

Ensure that only one elimination rule is applied (either PCC or 3A).

Adjust the Rule for FS Item 172100

In Define Rules for Elimination of Investments, set the scope to include only direct ownership.

Exclude indirect ownership from the investment elimination rule.

Group Shares / Ownership Manager

Check that Group Share (%) and Direct Share (%) are maintained correctly:

J0184 → J0196 = 30%

J0196 → J0197 = 40%

J0184 → J0197 = 12% (calculated, not directly maintained).

If you’ve maintained J0184 → J0197 directly, the system will trigger an extra elimination.

Document Types

Document type 0Z is for preparatory PCC entries,

Document type 3A is for investment/equity eliminations.
If both hit the same relationship, you’ll see a double elimination. Adjust the active document type for equity-accounted entities.

Practical resolution

In Central Ownership (App F3440), retain only the direct ownerships. Allow the system to calculate indirect shares automatically.

Assign the correct consolidation method to equity method entities so they are not subject to full investment elimination.

Run the consolidation again – you should see only one removal of the -8,000 cost, not both.


Your system is removing J0197 twice because indirect ownership is configured as if it were direct. Fix by:

Keep only direct links in ownership manager (J0184→J0196, J0196→J0197).

Allowing the system to calculate the indirect share (12%).

Ensuring the equity method consolidation does not cause double elimination.

Feel free to reach out if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to permanently delete / purge data from sac models
entry.content:
Hi @Noel_Munday,


In the version statistics, we see version statuses such as "active", "inactive", and "deleted". Below is an explanation of what each status means and how they affect resource usage:
 
Active Versions
  • Definition: An active version is one that is currently being used or is loaded into memory for planning tasks.
  • Resource Usage: Active versions consume HANA memory (RAM) as they are actively in use.
Inactive Versions
  • Definition: A version becomes inactive when it is automatically unloaded from memory. This typically happens during nightly maintenance processes.
  • Resource Usage: Inactive versions are persisted on the hard drive and do not consume HANA memory. However, they still occupy disk space.
  • Added Value: Knowing which versions are inactive allows you to report on them and delete those that are no longer needed. It also provides insights into the size of the versions and how the amount of data is growing, helping you to introduce planning areas or set limits if necessary.
 
Deleted Versions
  • Definition: A deleted version is one that has been marked for deletion by the system.
  • Resource Usage: Deleted versions do not consume any resource space on the tenant. They are completely removed from both memory and disk.
  • Administrator Actions: Once a version is deleted, it cannot be restored. The SAC administrator does not need to take any further action to purge deleted versions, as they are already permanently removed.
 
Conclusion
In summary, active versions consume HANA memory, inactive versions are persisted on the hard drive and do not consume HANA memory but still occupy disk space, while deleted versions do not consume any space and are permanently removed from the system.

entry.title: Re: Add form checkbox event
entry.content:
Hi @RicardoTorresDev ,

Unfortunately, SAP B1 authorizations don’t go down to UDF-level per user. You can restrict entire forms or actions, but not one field inside the form. You could block updates by validating the UDF value:

IF @object_type = '17' AND @transaction_type IN ('A','U') -- Sales Order
BEGIN
IF (SELECT U_MyCheckBox FROM RDR1 WHERE DocEntry = @list_of_cols_val_tab_del) = 'Y'
AND (SELECT UserCode FROM OUSR WHERE UserSign = @user_id) <> 'root'
BEGIN
SET @error = 1
SET @error_message = 'Only ROOT can tick this checkbox.'
END
END


This won’t disable the field visually, but it prevents saving if a non-root user tries to check it.

Regards,
Faraz Maqsud


Feel Free to Contact.

Fiver : https://www.fiverr.com/s/38dXAKY

LinkedIn:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/faraz-maqsud/

entry.title: abapGit plug-in to import the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario fails "Change recording must be activat
entry.content:
@CarineTchoutouo @Andre_Fischer 

Hi guys

I have SAP system S/4 HANA PUBLIC CLOUD.   I have Eclipse installed with the latest software updates as of 11th Sept 2025 eg. ABAP Development tool v3.52

I am encountering an issue when using the abapGit plug-in in ABAP Development Tools (ADT) in Eclipse to import the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario (https://github.com/SAP-samples/abap-platform-refscen-flight.git) into an ABAP Cloud Project in our S/4HANA Cloud public edition system. The import process fails with the error: "Change recording must be activated for package /DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE." Upon investigation, the abapGit Repository import process is unable to create it. I need assistance to resolve this issue and successfully import the SFLIGHT objects (e.g., /DMO/I_Flight, /DMO/I_Travel_U) for use in an AMDP class.

Following this abap-platform-refscen-flight/README.md at ABAP-platform-cloud · SAP-samples/abap-platform-refscen-flight

I have done as instructed but I am getting that error . I have seen SAP note 3630488 - Adt Package Builder: Package creation not possible because of missing Recording Changes Flag - SAP for Me
The package creation wizard was reworked in release SAP BTP 2508, so that it now requires the new ADT client 3.52  - But I am on that version.
